channel.title: Numpad keys
channel.description:
Well, I'm making another script for personal use, and I need to know the code for using the numpad keys. I mainly need to know what is needed to press the '5' on the numpad.
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Numpad keys
item.dc:creator: @mjordan mjordan
item.description:
@mjordan wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:4, topic:111277”]You can also do, “KeyDown(GetKeyCode(‘a’));”, wouldn’t be used here but it’s a much more convenient way than using variables to store “a’s” keycode.[/quote]Cool I didn’t know that. So why do people want to know the keycodes for buttons then? If you can just do this?

Read full topic

item.title: Numpad keys
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

You can also do, “KeyDown(GetKeyCode(‘a’));”, wouldn’t be used here but it’s a much more convenient way than using variables to store “a’s” keycode.

Read full topic

item.title: Numpad keys
item.dc:creator: @Janilabo Janilabo
item.description:
@Janilabo wrote:

######### Number Pad #########

0 - 96
1 - 97
2 - 98
3 - 99
4 - 100
5 - 101
6 - 102
7 - 103
8 - 104
9 - 105
Multiply - 106
Add - 107
Enter - 108
Subtract - 109
Decimal - 110
Divide - 111

I got that list from HERE.

Use KeyDown() and KeyUp() for those codes, eg:

{Example code to press number 1 from numpad} begin KeyDown(97); // KeyDown = for pressing key DOWN and 97 = number 1 from numpad.. Wait(20 + Random(15)); // Just small wait here, it's not necessary though. KeyUp(97); // KeyUp = for getting pressed key (back) UP and 97 = number 1 from numpad.. end.

Read full topic

item.title: Numpad keys
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

program New; var V: Variant; begin V:= GetKeyCode('5'); writeln(V); end.
There’s most likely an easier way to get it, but I can’t think of it right now. But there you go. To use the code printed out, use KeyDown and KeyUp.

Read full topic
